creator: jayson.nathan@convergys.com
text:
During the loading of a test class, if the test class fails to load, for 
example due to the failure of a static initialisation of a variable,  no output 
is produced by junit to let the user know that a class has failed to load.

On a similar note, but slightly different, if a forked JUnit test crashes the 
VM, one ends up with a empty XML file (using the XML logger), which 
<junitreport> later complains out, and the generated HTML report doesn't 
contain *any* mention of the test that crashed... --DD
